1: -module(ct_telnet_faulty_regexp_SUITE).
    2: 
    3: -compile(export_all).
    4: 
    5: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
    6: 
    7: -define(name, telnet_server_conn1).
    8: 
    9: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   10: %% TEST SERVER CALLBACK FUNCTIONS
   11: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
   12: 
   13: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   14:     Config.
   15: 
   16: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   17:     ok.
   18: 
   19: suite() -> [{require,?name,{unix,[telnet]}},
   20: 	    {require,ct_conn_log},
   21:  	    {ct_hooks, [{cth_conn_log,[]}]}].
   22: 
   23: all() ->
   24:     [expect_pattern,
   25:      expect_pattern_no_string,
   26:      expect_tag_pattern,
   27:      expect_tag_pattern_no_string,
   28:      expect_pattern_unicode,
   29:      expect_tag_pattern_unicode].
   30: 
   31: groups() ->
   32:     [].
   33: 
   34: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   35:     Config.
   36: 
   37: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   38:     Config.
   39: 
   40: init_per_testcase(_,Config) ->
   41:     ct:log("init_per_testcase: opening telnet connection...",[]),
   42:     {ok,_} = ct_telnet:open(?name),
   43:     ct:log("...done",[]),
   44:     Config.
   45: 
   46: end_per_testcase(_,_Config) ->
   47:     ct:log("end_per_testcase: closing telnet connection...",[]),
   48:     _ = ct_telnet:close(?name),
   49:     ct:log("...done",[]),
   50:     ok.
   51: 
   52: expect_pattern(_) ->
   53:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   54:     ok = ct_telnet:expect(?name, "invalid(pattern").
   55: 
   56: expect_pattern_no_string(_) ->
   57:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   58:     ok = ct_telnet:expect(?name, invalid_pattern).
   59: 
   60: expect_tag_pattern(_) ->
   61:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   62:     ok = ct_telnet:expect(?name, {tag,"invalid(pattern"}).
   63: 
   64: expect_tag_pattern_no_string(_) ->
   65:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   66:     ok = ct_telnet:expect(?name, {tag,invalid_pattern}).
   67: 
   68: %% Test that a unicode pattern can be given without the testcase
   69: %% failing.  Do however notice that there is no real unicode support
   70: %% in ct_telnet yet, that is, the telnet binary mode is not supported.
   71: expect_pattern_unicode(_) ->
   72:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   73:     {error,{prompt,_}} = ct_telnet:expect(?name, "pattern_with_unicode_αβ"),
   74:     ok.
   75: 
   76: expect_tag_pattern_unicode(_) ->
   77:     ok = ct_telnet:send(?name, "echo ayt"),
   78:     {error,{prompt,_}} = ct_telnet:expect(?name, "pattern_with_unicode_αβ"),
   79:     ok.
